document.docAuthor: Ziani, Stefano, Abdel-Dayem, Mahmoud Saleh, Aldhafer, Hathal Mohammed & Barbero, Enrico
document.masterDocTitle: An overview of the Onthophagini from the Arabian Peninsula (Coleoptera: Scarabaeoidea: Scarabaeidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: An overview of the Onthophagini from the Arabian Peninsula (Coleoptera: Scarabaeoidea: Scarabaeidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Literature quotes .
SAUDI
ARABIA
: “ Arabia ” ( Harold 1867 ). Makkah Province , “Djedda” (d’Orbigny 1900); “Buraiman”; “Ta’if”; “ Mecca ”; “Al Lith”; “Shi’aera [Al Shaira], antilocust camp north of Qunfidha” (Scott in Paulian 1948 ). Madinah Province , “ 16 km W Badr Hunayn”. Hejaz, “N Hedjaz” ( Zunino 1981 ). Yemen: without locality (Scott in Paulian 1948 ). “Nord Yemen” ( Paulian 1980 ). Oman: Muscat Governorate, “Muscat” (Scott in Paulian 1948 ). Without locality ( Janikova 1998 ).
UNITED
ARAB
EMIRATES
: without locality ( Gillett & Gillett 2005 ).

Distribution . Arabian Peninsula : Oman and Yemen (Scott in Paulian 1948 ),
Saudi Arabia
( Harold 1867 ), United Arab Emirates ( Gillett & Gillett 2005 ). North Africa : Algeria , Egypt , Morocco , Tunisia ( Baraud 1985 ). Africa : Eritrea , Somalia ( Balthasar 1963 ), Kenya (
Tagliaferri et al . 2012
). Asia : Iran ( Ziani & Bezděk 2016 ).

Remarks .
Onthophagus saudiensis
was described by Frey (1962) from two specimens from Makkah Province ,
Saudi Arabia
, and placed in the d’Orbigny (1913)’s 29 th group, that Frey himself called “29. Gruppe ochreatu s d’Orb.”. Actually, for
O. ochreatus d’Orbigny, 1898
and others species, almost thirty years before, Balthasar (1935) erected the subgenus
Micronthophagus
. For these reasons Zunino (1981) , not knowing
O. saudiensis ,
tentatively placed this species in the subgenus
Micronthophagus Balthasar, 1963
. As said above, the type series is constituted by two specimens, identified as males by Frey (1962) but actually two females. The author clearly stated ( Frey 1962 , p. 619): “Type im Britischen Museum, Paratype im meinem Museum” [Type in British Museum, Paratype in my Museum], discriminating between “Type” [= holotype ] and “ Paratype ”. Therefore, article 73.1.1. of the Code ( ICZN 1999 ) is met and the holotype is the specimen housed in BMNH, while specimen deposited in Frey’s collection is a paratype .

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype , fixed by original designation ( NHMB ): 1st, white with a horizontal yellow line, printed in black: “HEJAZ / Buraiman. / 12 miles N. of Jidda. /
8.xii.1944
. / A. R. Waterston. / B. M. 1947-349.”; 2nd, red, printed in black: “ PARATYPUS ”; 3rd, white, handwritten in blue and printed in black: “ P. Typus / Onthophagus / saudiensis / n sp / det. G. Frey , 1961”; 4th, white, printed and handwritten in black: “ Onthophagus (Erem.) / sticticus HAR. ♀ / J. SCHEUERN det. 98”; 5th, red handwritten in black: “comb. with / TYPE ♀ / saudiensis FREY / Brit. Mus . 2.99 / J. SCHEUERN vid”.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Paratype ( NHMUK ): 1st, white with a horizontal yellow line, printed in black: “HEJAZ / Buraiman. / 12 miles N. of Jidda. /
4.xii.1944
. / A. R. Waterston. / B. M. 1947-349.”; 2nd, round, white, encircled of red, printed in black: “Type”; 3rd, red, printd in black: “TYPUS”; 4th, white, handwritten in blue and printd in black: “Typus ♂ / Onthophagus / saudiensis / n sp / det. G. Frey , 1961”; 5th, white, handwritten in blue: “Synonymous / with / O. sticticus ”; 6th, white, printed and handwritten in black: “ Onthophagus (Erem.) / sticticus HAR. ♀ / J. SCHEUERN det. 98”; 7th, white, handwritten and printed in black: “ Onthophagus / sticticus HAR. / S. Ziani det. 19”
.

After the examination of both the specimens, we can propose the new synonymy
Onthophagus sticticus Harold, 1867
=
Onthophagus saudiensis Frey, 1962
new synonym
.
